# inputAccessoryViewController

**Instance Property**

The custom input accessory view controller to display when the responder becomes the first responder.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var inputAccessoryViewController: UIInputViewController? { get }
```

## Discussion

This property is typically used to attach an accessory view controller to the system-supplied keyboard that’s presented for [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextField] and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextView] objects.

The value of this read-only property is `nil`. If you want to attach custom controls to a system-supplied input view controller (such as the system keyboard) or to a custom input view (one you provide in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIResponder/inputViewController] property), redeclare this property as read-write in a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIResponder] subclass. You can then use this property to manage a custom accessory view. When the responder becomes the first responder, the responder infrastructure attaches the accessory view to the appropriate input view before displaying it.

## Managing input views

- **inputView**: The custom input view to display when the responder becomes the first responder.
- **inputViewController**: The custom input view controller to use when the responder becomes the first responder.
- **inputAccessoryView**: The custom input accessory view to display when the responder becomes the first responder.
- **reloadInputViews()**: Updates the custom input and accessory views when the object is the first responder.
